content: Lifestyle Asked by AnonymousAsked on 12 Sep 2019May I ask how the sale price of a second-hand car is derived?What are the factors that are taken into consideration?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Cedric Jamie Soh, Director at Seniorcare.com.sgTop Contributor (Sep)Level 7. Grand MasterUpdated on 13 Sep 2019PARF value, and the current value of the COE at the open market. And Annualised Depreciation of the car.The car body is worth very little money at the end of the 10 yrs COE (in relation to the total you fork out for PARF, COE and taxes)Find the car model that you like and visit https://www.sgcarmart.com/main/index.phpit's the best site to check out the PARF, the annual road tax, the yearly depreciation of that car you are keen to buy.3 comments1

See all 3 comments Cedric Jamie Soh13 Sep 2019Https://www.sgcarmart.com/used_cars/info.php?ID=854598&DL=1079

every car inside has an "annual depreciation"
from that u can estimate the depreciation for that model.
For example, this Vezel depreciates around $9140... other vezel would be around this figure tooWong YH13 Sep 2019Thank You!  Sorry, i missed that portion but u kindly reposted the thread. Much appreciated...
